pullRequest.body:
Shows that closed immersions are affine morphisms inducing affine locally surjective maps on sections.

---

### PR summary [13e495a4e4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15038/commits/13e495a4e4db4994790922e2ba0266e5848ccafc)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion | 1695 | 1705 | +10 (+0.59%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated`|7|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion`|10|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsClosedImmersion.hasAffineProperty`
`+ IsClosedImmersion.stableUnderBaseChange`
`+ Scheme.isNilpotent_iff_basicOpen_eq_bot`
`+ Scheme.zeroLocus_eq_top_iff_subset_nilradical`
`+ commRingIsoToRingEquiv_apply`
`+ commRingIsoToRingEquiv_symm_apply`
`+ exists_of_res_eq_of_qcqs`
`+ exists_of_res_eq_of_qcqs_of_top`
`+ exists_of_res_zero_of_qcqs`
`+ exists_of_res_zero_of_qcqs_of_top`
`+ exists_res_eq_zero_of_germ_eq_zero`
`+ germ_eq_zero_of_pow_mul_eq_zero`
`+ homeomorphOfContinuousClosed`
`+ injective_iff_map_algebraMap_eq`
`+ injective_of_map_algebraMap_zero`
`+ isAffine_surjective_of_isAffine`
`+ isIso_of_bijective_of_isClosedMap`
`+ isIso_of_bijective_of_isOpenMap`
`+ isIso_of_injective_of_isAffine`
`+ pow_mul_eq_zero_of_le`
`+ res_zero`
`+ stalkMap_injective`
`+ stalkMap_injective_of_isAffine`
`+ stalkMap_injective_of_isOpenMap_of_injective`
`+ surjective_of_isClosed_range_of_injective`
`+ Γevaluation_naturality`
`+ Γevaluation_naturality_apply`
`++ basicOpen_eq_bot_iff_forall_evaluation_eq_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15033~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Can you merge master and incorporate the new changes in the refactor? Thanks!

> Can you merge master and incorporate the new changes in the refactor? Thanks!

Done.

Thanks a lot!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Modulo Andrew's comment LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382378777/job/31665734010)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11382378777/job/31665734618)
Some bikeshedding on names. Not yet looked into the main bits.
Otherwise LGTM

```suggestion
/-- If `f : X ⟶ Spec A` is a morphism of schemes, then `Spec` of `specTargetImage f`  is the scheme-theoretic
```
Is this the intended meaning? (I was confused by "this ring".)
Ah, "this ring" is the ring `specTargetImage f`, i.e. "this" refers to the ring defined in this definition.
(note this part of this PR is from #15033, which this PR depends on)
Maybe also replace "this ring homomorphism" by "`specTargetImageRingHom f`".
I don't think the trailing `_of` is necessary? Same for `stalkMap_injective_of_isAffine_of`.

Is this just `ΓSpecIso_inv_ΓSpec_adjunction_homEquiv`?
What's the right spelling here? I'm thinking we should just remove `toSpecΓ`.
Good catch, this was accidentally re-introduced by merging.
I'm not entirely sure about the name. Maybe just `_of_top`.

```suggestion
lemma preimage_le (hUU' : U ≤ U') : f⁻¹ᵁ U ≤ f⁻¹ᵁ U' := fun _ ha ↦ hUU' ha
```

```suggestion
lemma germ_eq_zero_of_pow_mul_eq_zero {X : Scheme.{u}} {U : Opens X} (x : U) {f s : Γ(X, U)}
```
Maybe?

```suggestion
lemma res_eq_zero_of_germ_eq_zero (U : Opens X) (f : X.presheaf.obj (op U)) (x : U)
```
(or maybe `exists_`?)
Can you specialise this to schemes as well?
I think `IsLocalization.injective_iff` is a bit too generic for this. Maybe `injective_iff_map_algebraMap_eq` or something else that mentions `algebraMap`. Same for `injective_of`.

```suggestion
    X.zeroLocus s = ⊤ ↔ s ⊆ nilradical Γ(X, ⊤) :=
```
Does this not work?
I feel that we can drop the `_of_compactSpace`; same below.
Is this how it works?
I don't know if there is a shorter way, but removing any of these makes it fail or not have the correct explicitness of `M`.
Sure, let's merge it then.
It seems there is no shorter way, see https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/113488-general/topic/include.20in.20with.20variable.20in.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): closed immersions with affine target
